outline.text: Directions: Obtain a slide of prepared human blood.  Start on low power (10x or 20x) and
work your way to high power (40x), focusing under each objective. Under high power, draw a
portion of what you see. Use a pencil and pay attention to detail.
1. How many types of cells do you see? What is the difference between them? Why do
2. What is the composition of the cells that you see? In other words, estimate the
3. What is the role of blood? How do you think form (the structure of the blood cells)
4. If you have done this in previous labs, estimate the diameter of one of the cells.
